100 Days of #Bitcoin, Day 66

Mt. Gox, once the largest Bitcoin exchange, went bankrupt in 2014 after losing 850k BTC

Kraken's origin story traces back to this event. Founder Jesse Powell was inspired to create a safe, trusted crypto trading platform & accelerate global adoption

100 Days of #Bitcoin, Day 75

Bitcoin's public ledger audited every 10 minutes by every participant in the world is a revelation.

For the first time in history, we have a global accounting system that serves as a beacon of truth poised to revolutionize our monetary system.

100 Days of #Bitcoin, Day 88

1 BTC = 1 BTC means even if the price of one Bitcoin goes down in fiat terms, it‚Äôs still worth one Bitcoin. 

It's a testament to Bitcoin's immutable supply of 21 million tokens, rooted in physics and cryptography, that ensures consistency in value.

100 Days of #Bitcoin, Day 60

The first Bitcoin transaction occurred in January 2009, with programmer & Bitcoin legend Hal Finney receiving 10 #BTC from Satoshi Nakamoto.

This historic event marked the beginning of a new era in digital transactions.

100 Days of #Bitcoin, Day 63

Following Bitcoin's success, other cryptocurrencies, known as altcoins, began to emerge. Altcoins seek to enhance the original Bitcoin design by offering greater speed, anonymity, or some other advantage.

for a slightly less abstract example, consider the elliptic curve operation: P = k*G

this is the operation Bitcoin wallets use to derive a public key (P), given a private key (k)

however optimized libraries don't actually perform rote evaluation of the scalar base mult here
@theinstagibbs iirc some of the "Bitcoin ZKR" ppl have a version of similar tooling made with BDK & RISCZero

instead, they pre-compute look up tables that contain multiples of G (2G, 3G, 5G, etc): https://t.co/YDxh5GdarU

these tables are then used to reduce the amount of point additions it takes to do k*G: break up k into smaller chunks, look up those chunks in the table, sum chunks
